Meta.ShortDescription: A hematoma is a localized collection of blood outside the blood vessels, due to either disease or trauma including injury or surgery.

Relations.Relation: Bruise between the dura mater and arachnoid mater
Bruise between the skull and dura mater
Small pinpoint hematomas less than 3mm in diameter
Subcutaneous extravasation of blood in a thin layer under the skin over 1cm in diameter (black and blue)

Symptoms.Symptom: Brusing visible under the surface of the skin
Movement of hematoma, often due to gravity
